summary_comment: The professor's lectures are described as interesting and offering unique perspectives, but students found the workload excessive and the expectations unrealistic. Guidelines were unclear, and grading was harsh and subjective with little to no feedback provided. One student went as far as to call her the worst professor they have ever encountered, emphasizing the lack of structured guidelines and the subjectivity of her grading system.

Ratings.comment: I thought her lectures were fairly interesting and she definitely offered unique perspectives due to her background, but her class required a ridiculous amount of work. She also had unrealistic expectations, unclear guidelines, and graded very harshly.

I honestly believe that she is the worst professor that I have ever had and will ever have at any level of education. Her class follows no guidelines what so ever so if you have chosen to take this class, you better buckle up. She does not give any feedback on any assignments. Her grading is subjective and makes no sense. Good luck if you have her.

summary_comment: Dr. Hufton is highly regarded for her enthusiastic teaching approach, which激发你的创造力，让学生积极参与课堂讨论和实践活动，显著提升学生的思维能力和知识水平。她的课程结构清晰，作业量适中，并提供灵活的截止日期。学生普遍反映她非常关心学生的学习进展，并愿意根据学生的需求调整教学内容。她的评估方式多样，包括讨论帖子、小型项目和反思性作文，旨在促进深入学习。总体而言，学生认为这是一门高质量且值得

Ratings.comment: Dr. Hufton was always excited to teach us, so that made me excited to learn from her! You'll usually work with classmates during lecture and the in-class assignments are designed to make one think in a way that they usually haven't before. My brain is bigger because of her class.

Professor Hufton was great! 2410 was an easy online class, the work was very organized and there was a decent amount of writing it was over easy topics. There is a good amount of work, but is all easy and she gives 3 day extensions on all assignments.

Dr. Hufton truly cares about her students and I really enjoyed the opportunity to meet with her for feedback during office hours. The class consisted of discussion posts and small projects throughout the semester. I would say expect spending 2.5 hours on the class per week. Highly recommend this professor!

Dr. Hufton is the best professor I've had at OSU! The reflection essay assignments will seem intimidating at first, but you get used to writing them, they genuinely facilitate learning the material, and are not graded very tough. She really values student feedback and will dedicate time to what you really need and want to learn.

Great prof! No exams. Class is mandatory to receive points. One "press release" assignment and one research paper (5-6 pages), and discussion boards. Have to watch a weekly lecture before coming to class (ours was just on Mondays) and then we have an in-class assignment during class as well that is easy but expands knowledge on the topic. Def take!

SEI.Subject: PUBHLTH
SEI.Class Name: Critical Issues in Global Public Health

SEI.Subject: PUBHLTH
SEI.Class Name: Critical Issues in Global Public Health

SEI.Subject: PUBHLTH
SEI.Class Name: Critical Issues in Global Public Health

summary_comment: The professor receives overwhelmingly negative feedback from students, describing the class as excessively burdensome and poorly structured. Students unanimously advise against taking the class, citing unfair grading, unclear instructions, and an unreasonable workload. While some note the professor is a nice person outside the classroom, the consensus is that the class is not worth the effort and there are better alternatives available.

Ratings.comment: Horrible class.  If you have the option, don't take it.

if you dont have to take this class for credit, DO NOT TAKE IT. unbearably tedious work he is no help and his instructions are terrible. his grading is very unfair especially with how he sets up the course. i could go on for days about him and this course overall but i will just end it with AVOID AT ALL COSTS OR ANY OTHER CLASS HE MIGHT TEACH.

Simply way too much work for a 2-credit hour course. I can't even believe it's allowed to be listed as 2 credit hours when I'm taking 5-credit hours courses that are literally not even half the work that this class demands. While the content is rather useful to learn, I don't believe this class is worth the burden. There are much better options.

Let me be straight forward here, Danny is a nice guy, probably great guy outside of the classroom. My bottom line is that this guy is giving a work load larger than my other four classes combined. When you sit down to work, be ready to spend more than 6 hours doing it... He had no rating so I had to do it, I do not recommend this class in any way.

summary_comment: Professor Habash is highly regarded for her caring nature and passion for teaching, making her approachable and engaging despite some less dynamic lecture styles. Her tests are generally fair and easy with proper preparation, and she encourages a collaborative learning environment through group work. However, some students find her lectures repetitive and the class structure lacking, while others struggled with the frequent quizzes and final project. Overall, while the class can be challenging, many find her support and fairness valuable.

Ratings.comment: The lectures could drag a bit, especially if you already read the book for that week. She is the most caring professor I have ever had, you can really tell she wants us to learn. Her tests were very fair and easy with studying her study guide. Very positive experience as a whole.

Very caring prof but I did not like the course. Not a ton of structure and I did not think this class should have daily attendance but it did. I liked how we always worked in groups. She is very passionate over what she teaches which good but this class feels centered for med majors rather than just a GE. The assignments are long but there's only 5

I loved Professor Habash! While some of her lectures can get a little repetitive if you're also reading the text, she makes class interesting nonetheless. She is also such a genuinely caring person, which makes her super approachable about class content and life in general. I wish I could take her again.

Great professor! Really enjoyed her class and thought that it was very interesting. She was easy to reach outside of classes and was willing to stay after anytime. There is a lot of reading, but lectures tend to cover the majority of the material so its not a big deal. There arent too many assignments, and they are fairly simple!

Professor Habash is a super nice person, but the class itself can drag on. Each week you are given chapters to read and then she lectures about them. The lectures themselves are really boring as it feels like she is reciting what the book discussed. Despite this the exams are pretty easy and the few assignments you have are not awful.

This class was just a complete disaster. I never knew what was going on and it was so much stress in your final semester of college. Unfortunately, everyone has to take this for 3 fantastic hours on Friday mornings but beware. Quizzes are based on tiny little details in research papers and the final project is just tons of work in a short time.

SEI.Subject: HTHRHSC
SEI.Class Name: The Evolving Art and Science of Medicine

SEI.Subject: HTHRHSC
SEI.Class Name: The Evolving Art and Science of Medicine

summary_comment: The professor delivers high-quality content but struggles with classroom dynamics, often appearing awkward when attempting humor. His teaching is effective and thorough, despite the comedic missteps that occasionally occur. Students appreciate his expertise and dedication to the subject matter. However, his approach to engaging the class through humor is less successful, leaving some students feeling uncomfortable. Overall, his teaching quality is strong, though there is room for improvement in his interpersonal skills.

Ratings.comment: Course is kind awkward when he tried to make people laugh.

summary_comment: Marla is a highly regarded ASL professor who is deaf and brings a unique perspective to her teaching. Students appreciate her care and dedication, finding her to be one of the best ASL instructors available. However, some students describe her as strict and challenging, noting that clear communication of expectations and organization can be lacking. Despite these challenges, many students find her approach enriching and immersive, particularly in understanding Deaf culture.

Ratings.comment: Absolute worst professor I have had in all 4 years I've been here. I had her for 3350 and 4189S and she was equally terrible for both. Does not communicate expectations for assignments and is a tough grader.

I have genuinely never hated a class so much. I love ASL and was excited for the minor and this class crushed any passion I had for the language. The professor talks in circles and the class is completely disorganized. You have to buy multiple books that are difficult to find and need to have them for graded classwork.

Marla is Governor Mike Dewine's interpreter. She is also the only deaf ASL interpreter in Ohio. She is strict, but if you go to class, pay attention and participate, you'll be just fine. She is nice and cares for her students as long as you are putting in effort. She prepares you very well and tells you exactly what she wants.
Marla is the most thoughtful teach and cares about all of her students! Her way of teaching each unit is helpful and you really immerse yourself into Deaf culture! By far the best ASL professor!!

Marla is an incredible instructor!!! She is deaf which may be intimidating at first, but honestly this only helped! This was my first exposure to ASL and she was so caring and wanted every student to succeed! She also makes sure that everyone understands what is expected of them on exams and prepares you very well!!

SEI.Subject: ASL
SEI.Class Name: Intersection of American Sign Language, Deaf Culture, and the Deaf Community

SEI.Subject: ASL
SEI.Class Name: Intersection of American Sign Language, Deaf Culture, and the Deaf Community

SEI.Subject: ASL
SEI.Class Name: Intersection of American Sign Language, Deaf Culture, and the Deaf Community

summary_comment: This professor is known for being a rigorous grader, which some students find challenging. His lectures are described as boring and difficult to follow, often lacking visual aids like slides. In contrast, another philosophy professor, Steven Brown, is highly regarded for making the subject more accessible and engaging. Students find Brown's approach much more effective in helping them understand philosophy.

Ratings.comment: He is a tough grader! I learned NOTHING throughout the whole semester. His lecture is BORING and hard to understand. All he did in this class was keep talking without slides. I am taking another philosophy class by Steven Brown this semester. He is way better than YH W. Steven Brown makes me realize that philosophy is not that hard to understand.

summary_comment: Professor Miranda is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, consistently receiving praise for her sweet and charismatic demeanor. She excels in explaining projects clearly and encouraging students to take risks while striving for excellence. Her dedication extends to one-on-one interactions during class, ensuring personalized attention and support. Students find her classes well-structured, exciting, and filled with positive feedback, making her a standout professor in the art department.

Ratings.comment: c u next tuesday

I took the Painting I course with Miranda and loved it! She is very sweet and charismatic. She explains the projects well and encourages all students to try their best and take risks. Another thing I liked is she takes the time to walk around the room and talk to each person one-on-one. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone interested!

I loved my time with Art 2100 and I think Miranda was a huge part of that. Incredibly sweet, very supportive, great feedback, well-structured classes, and always made class exciting and interesting. I would absolutely take another class by her and find her to be a wonderful professor. Totally recommend any art students to look into her classes!

summary_comment: Jeff is an effective teacher in terms of making the material accessible through memorization, though his approach can be challenging and may lead to confusion during lectures. Exams are known to be rigorous and sometimes overly nitpicky, with low average scores on initial tests. While he is described as a nice person, students find him lacking in exam preparation and lecture organization. Additionally, some students experienced him as unprofessional and difficult to follow due to his demeanor and pacing during classes.

Ratings.comment: I'm terrible at science and took this class as an easy A, but I ended up with the B. The labs are very easy; however, the exams can get knit picky. The average for the first one was a 69 which is unheard of for an Earth Science course. Jeff is a nice guy, but he isn't a very good professor and doesn't know how to prepare a class for an exam.

The class was relatively easy, just memorization.  He would get angry for insignificant things and take it out on the class by speeding through the lectures so you could barely understand.  He would not act professional and he had this look like he was staring into the sun half the time

summary_comment: Professor Levas is highly regarded for making his classes enjoyable and engaging, with a great sense of humor that keeps students interested. He is committed to student success, encouraging thorough preparation and attendance at review sessions. Students appreciate his genuine interest in their learning and his realistic approach to expectations. While some recommend against purchasing the textbook, Professor Levas effectively teaches using other materials. Overall, he is considered one of the best instructors, known for his supportive and relaxed teaching style.

Ratings.comment: Made class enjoyable. Very interesting lectures and down to Earth. Would take again.

Prof. Levas has a great sense of humor and made lecture interesting. He is very committed to helping students do their best. Be sure to study for the exams, they get progressively more difficult. Use the study guides and attend review sessions because they help a lot.

If you have the option to select this teacher for one of your classes, take it. By far one of the best teachers I've had the pleasure of having. His class is relaxed and fun, he really does care about getting you to pass. Agreed with other users, the book is a waste of money, you only need the lab book.

Easy A, hilarious and great professor, do not buy the textbook. Dr.Levas genuinely wants people to pass the class, he obviously loves teaching, and he's realistic about expectations from his students. Loved the class!

Great Teacher! He was really interested in the subject but understood that everyone was taking the course as a gen ed. Gave out 5 quizzes at random times thought the semester that keeps you wanting to show up to class. Tests were easy and labs were extremely simple. Also, DON'T BUY THE TEXTBOOK, its not necessary even though he says it is.
Fun time in class & hilarious teacher, buy too much no classes.

summary_comment: Professor Kim excels in her passion for art history but faces challenges due to her strong Korean accent, making her sometimes difficult to understand. Despite this, students appreciate her enthusiasm and generosity in grading. Attending classes and taking notes are key to success in her course, as it leads to high grades. Overall, she is highly regarded for her dedication and positive teaching approach.

Ratings.comment: Professor Kim is so nice and sweet! She's very passionate about what she teaches. However, she is a little hard to understand at times because she has a strong Korean accent

She is very enthusiastic about art history, she is straight out of Korea, so she is a little hard to understand at times. She tries very hard, and is more than generous with grading. Go to class and take notes, and you will get an A.

summary_comment: Professor Filipi is highly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject matter, which he effectively conveys through his lectures and pop quizzes. However, his teaching style is criticized for being less engaging, with lectures often consisting of passive viewings rather than in-depth analysis. Students find the content informative but not particularly enriching. The pop quizzes are noted for their strictness, imposing significant penalties for tardiness. Overall, while the professor's expertise is undeniable, his instructional methods are seen as lacking in depth and engagement

Ratings.comment: Very knowledgeable and engaged with the material throughout the class. Knows a lot about the class and is excited to be teaching. Gives some pop quizzes, but as long as you're present in lectures and not asleep, you can ace all of them with ease.

Prof. Filipi is a passionate and knowledgeable professor, a true film/animation enthusiast, but not a great instructor. Lectures are more viewings with idle background info than a meaningful dive into the history of animation. The content is not bad, but I did not find it very enriching. Pop quizzes are also a killer, heavy penalty if remotely late

I noticed David didn't have a Rate My Professor page, so I made it because people need to know to not take a class with him. He drones on and on in lecture but you better take notes, because you're not gonna find that information anywhere else. I'm in class right now and had to make this because I'm so sick of his "teaching."
